sprint_goal: Establish the foundational data model, persistence layer, and a fully automated CI/CD pipeline for the Order Management Service.
key_deliverables: TypeORM entities for Order data model; Order repository with transactional logic; Dockerfile for service; Terraform for EKS, SQS/SNS; GitHub Actions CI/CD pipeline.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate a successful CI/CD pipeline run deploying the skeleton service to EKS; Show database schema created from migrations.
success_criteria: CI/CD pipeline successfully deploys to staging; All database migrations apply cleanly; 100% of planned tasks completed.
risk_factors: CI/CD pipeline complexity (RISK-006); Incorrect IAM policies for AWS resources.
mitigation_strategies: Use OIDC for GitHub-AWS auth; Include manual approval step in initial pipeline; Peer review all Terraform and IAM policies.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with 50% completion by day 5.

sprint_goal: Implement the core, user-facing order creation saga, from checkout initiation to payment intent creation, governed by a strict state machine.
key_deliverables: Finite state machine for order lifecycle; `POST /api/v1/orders/checkout` endpoint; Integration with Vendor service for inventory check; Integration with Payments service for payment intent creation.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate a successful API call to the checkout endpoint; Show order creation in `payment_pending_confirmation` state; Show circuit breakers tripping on simulated downstream service failure.
success_criteria: Checkout API is testable and initiates the saga; State machine unit tests have 100% coverage; Circuit breakers are implemented and monitored.
risk_factors: High risk of inconsistent states in saga (RISK-001); Synchronous dependency on external services (RISK-002); API contract delays from other teams (RISK-003).
mitigation_strategies: Implement consumer-driven contract testing (Pact); Develop against mock servers; Low capacity utilization provides a large buffer for complexity.
external_dependencies: Vendor & Catalog Service API, Payments & Settlements Service API
integration_windows: Integration testing on day 7-9 against staging versions of dependent services.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with 50% completion by day 5.

sprint_goal: Complete the end-to-end order lifecycle by handling all post-payment events, status updates, cancellations, and failure scenarios.
key_deliverables: Event handler for payment confirmation; API for customer order cancellation; Event listeners for all vendor and rider status updates.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate an E2E order flow from placement to 'Delivered' status; Demonstrate a successful customer cancellation with a refund request event.
success_criteria: Full order lifecycle is functional and testable via API and events; All event handlers are idempotent.
risk_factors: Bugs in event handlers causing inconsistent states (RISK-001); Race conditions in cancellation logic; Events arriving out of order.
mitigation_strategies: Comprehensive integration testing of the entire saga; Implement idempotency keys in event handlers; State machine logic must reject out-of-order transitions.
external_dependencies: Events from Vendor, Payments, and Rider services.
integration_windows: Continuous integration testing as event handlers are developed.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with 50% completion by day 5.
